result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel Hull was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Miguel Hull is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Miguel Hull was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Miguel Hull was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $200 DNA surcharge remitted. $353  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Crt costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with AH w/o prior written approval of agent.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

to Br. 15
Reporter:  Colleen Clark;  Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.
Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Dennis E. Burke.  Corey Charles Stephan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed. CT accepted waiver.
Preliminary hearing on March 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Amanda H.
- Defendant shall not be within the village limits of Mount Horeb, WI
- The Court finds sustantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur.  The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969.
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $2000.00 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.   If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 15

Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Adrienne Blais appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
